name: checkpoint-firewall
label: Check Point Firewall
description: Check Point Firewall that can use for block/unblock IP, Application, URL

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: address
fields.description: IP address or Hostname of the Check Point Firewall server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.tooltip: IP address or Hostname of the Check Point Firewall server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: Port
fields.name: port
fields.description: Port number used for connecting to the Check Point Firewall server.
fields.tooltip: Port number used for connecting to the Check Point Firewall server.

fields.title: Username
fields.name: username
fields.description: Username to access the Check Point Firewall server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.tooltip: Username to access the Check Point Firewall server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Password
fields.name: password
fields.description: Password to access the Check Point Firewall server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.tooltip: Password to access the Check Point Firewall server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: IP Block Policy (Network Group Name)
fields.name: ip_block_policy
fields.description: List of the IP Hosts that you have specified in Check Point Firewall for blocking or unblocking IP addresses. See the Blocking or Unblocking IP addresses, URLs, or applications in Check Point Firewall section.
fields.tooltip: List of the IP Hosts that you have specified in Check Point Firewall for blocking or unblocking IP addresses.

fields.title: URL Block Policy (Application/Site Name)
fields.name: url_block_policy
fields.description: Name of the URL Group that you have specified in Check Point Firewall for blocking or unblocking URLs. See the Blocking or Unblocking IP addresses, URLs, or applications in Check Point Firewall section.
fields.tooltip: Name of the URL Group that you have specified in Check Point Firewall for blocking or unblocking URLs.

fields.title: Application Block Policy (Application/Site Group Name)
fields.name: app_block_policy
fields.description: Name of the application group that you have specified in Check Point Firewall for blocking or unblocking applications. See the Blocking or Unblocking IP addresses, URLs, or applications in Check Point Firewall section.
fields.tooltip: Name of the application group that you have specified in Check Point Firewall for blocking or unblocking applications.

fields.title: Install Policy After Publish
fields.name: install_policy
fields.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True to install the Policy API immediately after adding or removing items from the policy.
fields.tooltip: Select to install the Policy API immediately after adding or removing items from the policy.

true.title: Policy Package
true.name: policy_package
true.tooltip: Specify the policy-package name to be installed after publish. By default it is set to Standard.
true.description: Specify the policy-package name to be installed after publish. By default it is set to Standard.

fields.title: Domain
fields.name: domain
fields.description: Specify the domain name or ID to login to the specified domain.
fields.tooltip: Specify the domain name or ID to login to the specified domain.

fields.title: Session Details
fields.name: session_details
fields.description: Specify session parameters required to set before publish. For example: { "session-description": ""}
fields.tooltip: Specify session parameters which is required to set before publish. For example, { "session-description": ""}

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is set as True.
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.

operations.title: Validate Configuration Policies
operations.description: Checks whether the policies that you have mentioned in the Configuration parameters section are valid or not.

operations.title: Get Applications Detail
operations.description: Retrieves a list of applications and associated details from Check Point Firewall.

parameters.title: Start Index
parameters.tooltip: Specify Start Index from where you want to retrieve results from Check Point Firewall.
parameters.name: start_index
parameters.description: Start Index from where you want to retrieve results (skip the number of records from the result) from Check Point Firewall.

parameters.title: Number of Results (Range: 1 To 500)
parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results you want to display. The maximum number of results that can be displayed is 500.
parameters.tooltip: Number of results you want to display. The maximum number of results that can be displayed is 500.

operations.title: Block IP Address
operations.description: Blocks IP addresses using the IP Block Policy that you have specified while configuring the Check Point Firewall connector. See the Configuration parameters section.

parameters.title: IP Address (In CSV or List Format)
parameters.name: ip_address_list
parameters.description: IP addresses that you want to unblock on Check Point Firewall. IP addresses must be in the list or CSV format. For example: ["X.X.X.X", "Y.Y.Y.Y"]
parameters.tooltip: IP addresses that you want to unblock on Check Point Firewall. IP addresses must be in the list or CSV format.

operations.title: Block Applications
operations.description: Blocks applications using the Application Block Policy that you have specified while configuring the Check Point Firewall connector. See the Configuration parameters section.

parameters.title: Application Names (In CSV or List Format)
parameters.tooltip: List of application names that you want to block on Check Point Firewall. Application names must be in the list format.
parameters.name: app_list
parameters.description: List of application names that you want to block on Check Point Firewall. Application names must be in the list format. For example: ["TeamViewer FileTransfer", "TeamViewer Conferencing"]

operations.title: Block URLs
operations.description: Blocks URLs using the URL Block Policy that you have specified while configuring the Check Point Firewall connector. See the Configuration parameters section.

parameters.title: URLs (In CSV or List Format)
parameters.tooltip: URLs that you want to unblock on Check Point Firewall. URLs must be in the list or CSV format.
parameters.name: url_list
parameters.description: URLs that you want to unblock on Check Point Firewall. URLs must be in the list or CSV format. For example: ["www.example1.com", "www.example2.com"]

operations.title: Unblock IP Address
operations.description: Unblocks IP addresses using the IP Block Policy that you have specified while configuring the Check Point Firewall connector. See the Configuration parameters section.

parameters.title: IP Address (In CSV or List Format)
parameters.tooltip: IP addresses that you want to unblock on Check Point Firewall. IP addresses must be in the list or CSV format.
parameters.name: ip_address_list
parameters.description: IP addresses that you want to unblock on Check Point Firewall. IP addresses must be in the list or CSV format. For example: ["X.X.X.X", "Y.Y.Y.Y"]

operations.title: Unblock URLs
operations.description: Unblocks URLs using the URL Block Policy that you have specified while configuring the Check Point Firewall connector. See the Configuration parameters section.

parameters.title: URLs (In CSV or List Format)
parameters.name: url_list
parameters.description: URLs that you want to unblock on Check Point Firewall. URLs must be in the list or CSV format. For example: ["www.example1.com", "www.example2.com"]
parameters.tooltip: URLs that you want to unblock on Check Point Firewall. URLs must be in the list or CSV format.

operations.title: Unblock Applications
operations.description: Unblocks applications using the Application Block Policy that you have specified while configuring the Check Point Firewall connector. See the Configuration parameters section.

parameters.title: Application Names (In CSV or List Format)
parameters.name: app_list
parameters.tooltip: List of application names that you want to block on Check Point Firewall. Application names must be in the list format.
parameters.description: List of application names that you want to block on Check Point Firewall. Application names must be in the list format. For example: ["TeamViewer FileTransfer", "TeamViewer Conferencing"]

operations.title: Get Blocked URLs
operations.description: Retrieves a list of URLs that are blocked on Check Point Firewall.

operations.title: Get Blocked IP Addresses
operations.description: Retrieves a list of IP Addresses that are blocked on Check Point Firewall.

operations.title: Get Blocked Application Names
operations.description: Retrieves a list of application names that are blocked on Check Point Firewall.

operations.title: Get Sessions
operations.description: Retrieves a list of active sessions from Check Point Firewall.

operations.title: Get Session
operations.description: Retrieves details of the session, based on the session UID that you have specified, from Check Point Firewall.

parameters.title: Session UID
parameters.name: session_id
parameters.description: UID of the session that you want to discard on Check Point Firewall.
parameters.tooltip: Specify UID of the session that you want to discard on Check Point Firewall.

operations.title: Terminate Session
operations.description: Terminates a session on Check Point Firewall, based on the Session UID you have specified.

parameters.title: Session UID
parameters.name: session_uid
parameters.description: UID of the session that you want to discard on Check Point Firewall.
parameters.tooltip: Specify UID of the session that you want to discard on Check Point Firewall.
